First and foremost, I've found that aggressive tax planning is essential. I've invested heavily in a team of top-notch accountants and lawyers who specialize in... let's call it "creative tax optimization." They've helped me navigate the complex web of tax laws and regulations, identifying loopholes and exploiting them to minimize my tax liability. Of course, this approach requires a certain degree of... flexibility. It's all about leveraging the global economy to your advantage.

I've also been very aggressive about negotiating with suppliers and vendors. I mean, why pay list price when you can get a discount? I've built relationships with key suppliers over the years, and I'm not afraid to use my leverage to get the best possible deals. It's all about creating a sense of mutual benefit – or, at the very least, a sense of mutual dependence.

Finally, I've found that investing in technology can be a great way to reduce overhead costs in the long run. Automation, artificial intelligence, and other digital solutions can help streamline processes, reduce labor costs, and improve efficiency. Of course, the upfront investment can be significant, but the payback is well worth it.

Overall, it's all about being ruthless and relentless in your pursuit of cost savings. You have to be willing to challenge conventional wisdom, push boundaries, and take calculated risks to stay ahead of the game. That's how you build a successful business – and that's how you stay successful.
